dragonn.resources.files

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • dragonn.resources.files.Sprite

  • public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic resource for sprite-based games. Please note that there is a missingtex.png in dev/res. Removing that and failing to load a texture will immediately crash the program.
    Version:
    V1.0.0B (1/12/2014)
    Author:
    Leo Henri

      Sprite(java.lang.String imgPath, int frameWidth, int frameHeight, int frameCount)
      An animation, it allows the use of all functions in the Sprite object.
      Sprite(java.lang.String imgPath, int frameWidth, int frameHeight, int frameDelay, int frameCount)
      An animation, it allows the use of all functions in the Sprite object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String imgPath)
        A basic sprite. Does not allow for any spritesheet or animation functions
        Parameters:
        imgPath - Path to an image, relative to the main file path.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String imgPath,
      int spriteWidth,
      int spriteHeight)
        A spritesheet. Allows the functions of both a sprite and spritesheet, but does not allow animation functions.
        Parameters:
        imgPath - Path to an image, relative to the main file path.
        spriteWidth - Width of each subsprite, in pixels.
        spriteHeight - Height of each subsprite, in pixels.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String imgPath,
      int frameWidth,
      int frameHeight,
      int frameCount)
        An animation, it allows the use of all functions in the Sprite object.
        Parameters:
        imgPath - Path to an image, relative to the main file path.
        frameWidth - Width, in pixels, of each frame of the animation
        frameHeight - Height, in pixels, of each frame of the animation
        frameCount - Number of frames in the animation.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String imgPath,
      int frameWidth,
      int frameHeight,
      int frameDelay,
      int frameCount)
        An animation, it allows the use of all functions in the Sprite object.
        Parameters:
        imgPath - Path to an image, relative to the main file path.
        frameWidth - Width, in pixels, of each frame of the animation
        frameHeight - Height, in pixels, of each frame of the animation
        frameDelay - Delay, in frames, between the each frame of the animation.
        frameCount - Number of frames in the animation.

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Basic Sprite class.
        Returns:
        The BufferedImage that most Sprite classes use for their functions.

      • getSubImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSubImage(int x,
                                       int y,
                                       int length,
                                       int height)
        Method to get the subimage of this Sprite object's base image.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the subimage you want to grab.
        y - The Y coordinate of the subimage you want to grab.
        length - The length of the subimage, in pixels.
        height - The height of the subimage, in pixels.
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage of the selected area.

      • getSubImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSubImage(int column,
                                       int row)
        Method to get the subimage of this Sprite object's base image.
        Parameters:
        column - The column that the subimage is located in
        row - The row the subimage is located in
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage of the selected subsprite

        Get the current frame that the animation is on.
        Returns:
        The current frame, as an Integer.

      • currentAnim

        public int currentAnim()
        Get the current animation that is playing
